message.text: So there you are, The Golden Finger Hero! Our country was attacked by evil monsters, please save us! Tutorial: hold Z to continue dialog and open achievement window, press Z to attack.
"A strange energy wave coming out of my finger! What the fuck is going on here?!"
What are you waiting for? Are you the first time to play tutorial? As the most talented developer in this planet, I had invented the simplest and most elegant gameplay -- only by one key!
“I bought this game for it's 18+ rating, but what's wrong of this developer...”
So let me start the tutorial again, this game only need your Z key so even Stephen Hawking can play this! Simple enough? Better than other tutorials costs you 10 years to finish!
“What the hell was that opening music... seems the only point of this game is this hot girl...”
Aww, you might thought: How the fuck can I finish this game by one key?!
You are so smart, it's true! But isn't it the way that every other mobile game companies made their games these days?
You have to kill 999999 enemies and level up to 100 to finish this game.
So you want to give up? Good, shut down your device, take a walk outside, take a deep breath...
Meet your old friends... or you can even pay us through IAP to gain today's special deal: Yet Another Epic Game In History 2!
But if you still want to continue, maybe we can talk later, I will be right back.
When I first played these "epic" games, I thought game developers were the god of their worlds.
After many years, I found myself wrong. The bloody god of game is not our developers, it's you! The players!
You complained you don't have that much time to learn our game system, so we tried our best to make them the simplest as we can.
Then you said the control was too complex! So we developed this gameplay with only 1 key, and then we can't even find a place to put the IAP button!
Do you know Pavlov's dog? If our game makes players give up thinking, then what's the difference between the dogs and the players?
So what do we do now? What the fuck can we do now? I have no answer.
So you have played my awful game so long, I've decided to offer my tiny little help...
GameController.Instance.Level = 100; Are you grateful?
So, QWER looks good to me, try these keys at your next playthrough(if there will be any).
Select:3
ALL DONE!
